SIGNSTREAM-DATABASE.DISTRIBUTOR: American Sign Language Linguistic Research Project, Boston University, Boston, MA.
SIGNSTREAM-DATABASE.AUTHOR: Fran Conlin, Mike Schlang, Robert G. Lee, Sarah Fish, and Carol Neidle. The data have been transcribed at Boston University under the supervision of C. Neidle. We gratefully acknowledge assistance from Lana Cook and Carla DaSilva.

PARTICIPANT.LABEL: Mike
PARTICIPANT.NAME: Michael Schlang
PARTICIPANT.BACKGROUND: Education: Attended BSD (Boston School for the Deaf) and graduated from NNHS (Newton North); attended Gallaudet University; graduated from CSUN (2003).

TRACK.A: Did John read the book? When?
You see the book over there? John finished reading it yesterday.
Mother should not buy that car.
I have never seen John's car.
Do you understand? Am I clear?
Will mother read a book later?
Yes, it will be better if I stand up so it's more clear but, (whatever).
Has John finished reading the book?
I have never seen John's car.
The student's mother will buy him a car, I'm sure.
Mother is planning to read the book later.
Did the student's mother buy a car already?
Which house did the student's father buy?
Why did mother buy a car?

UTTERANCE.NOTES: Note that the non-dominant handshape in ABOUT is a perseveration of the handsape from the preceding Index.

TRACK.A: John was reading that book, what did he say it is about?
